title: Drawing, "Project for a wallpaper frieze", 1780–1800
medium: Pen and ink, brush and gouache, oxydized white on paper
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: The repeat consists of group of three girls and a boy, dancing, and two boys playing marbles. Trees, plants. At lower margin is frieze transposing the triglyph motif into rail and garland.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Project for a wallpaper frieze", 1780–1800.
1780–1800. Pen and ink, brush and gouache, oxydized white on paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1920-36-16.
